Key Arguments: The Bill does not adequately address varying interpretations of truth and falsehood between social media companies and the government.
Concerns about infringing on freedom of speech and the potential 'chilling effect' on online discussions.
The legislation may inadvertently validate conspiracy theories and drive traffic to alternative platforms.
The Bill could empower foreign regimes to justify their own restrictions on free speech.
A better solution would be to implement critical thinking courses in schools to address misinformation.
Notable Quotes: The 'chilling effect' of this piece of legislation should be a cause for concern for all Australians who wish to have online discussions on new and challenging ideas.
A better alternative... would be bringing in critical thinking courses in schools that deal with misinformation and propaganda and how to spot it.
